entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 08 at 3:58PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Colder Temperatures Over The Interior This Weekend... The Tanana Valley temperatures will drop to 10 to 20 below tonight and Saturday, with 20 to 30 below possible by Sunday. The Northern Interior will see temperatures drop to 20 to 30 below on Saturday night and Sunday. A warming trend is expected over the Interior starting on Monday.

Total snow accumulations between 4 and 7 inches in the Methow Valley with 8 to 12 inches over the mountains. The heaviest accumulations are expected to occur between late Saturday afternoon through early Sunday morning.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Western Okanogan County

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued December 08 at 11:30AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...THREAT OF RIVER FLOODING BEGINNING SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY FOR PARTS OF CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN WESTERN WASHINGTON... A frontal system will bring another round of widespread lowland rain and mountain snow with snow levels rising to 5500 and 7000 feet. entry.summary: ...HIGH WIND WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...West winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 70 mph possible. * WHERE...Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County, North Snowy Range Foothills and South Laramie Range.
